page.title: 01GENERAL SURVEY OF AREA
page.content: This area is part of the Peak District National Park. Here is found high moorland, river and valley scenery, with the man-made addition of the twin reservoirs of Fernilee and Errwood. The character of the area has changed considerably over the years. Before the reservoirs were built, a thriving farming community and railway existed. Now most forms of human habitation have vanished, leaving an area that is visited by thousands of people every year but which paradoxically remains sparsely inhabited. The popularity of this area is due partly to it being within easy access of many neighbouring cities.
